intro: Sericolea lanata, commonly known as the hairy sericolea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves and stems, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It is native to regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. Sericolea lanata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
